newsitem.title: CHILE: Chile paper pulp exports show sharp rise in April.
newsitem.headline: Chile paper pulp exports show sharp rise in April.

text.p: Chilean paper pulp exports surged to $71.8 million last month from $47.5 million in the same period last year, though overall non-copper exports dropped in April, the central bank said on Friday.
Chile's non-copper exports slipped to $952.2 million from $1.04 billion in April 1996, the bank said in its twice-monthly report.

But booming copper exports, which rose to $658 million from $512 million, accounted for a sharp increase in exports in the first four months of the year, which climbed to $6.05 billion from $5.61 billion in January to April 1996, it said.
